questions.question: There are only ......................... apples on the tree.
questions.description: Only a few means the same as few.

questions.question: There aren't .............................. apples on the tree.
questions.description: We use many before a plural noun.

questions.question: We don't have ............................ time to finish the work.
questions.description: We use much before an uncountable noun.

questions.question: I collected ................................ money than my brother.
questions.description: We use less before an uncountable noun.

questions.question: Now I have got ............................... problems than I used to have.
questions.description: We use fewer before a plural noun.

questions.question: I solved the problem with ............................. difficulty.
questions.description: We use little before an uncountable noun.

questions.question: There were ............................... people at the party.
questions.description: We use few before a plural noun.

questions.question: There is very ............................ sugar in the jar. We should buy some.
questions.description: We use little before an uncountable noun.

questions.question: There were ................................. students than expected.
questions.description: We use fewer before a plural noun.

questions.question: ........................... politicians are really honest.
questions.description: We use few before a plural noun.
